abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Education Sector
            Development Support Credit Project for Bangladesh were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the Bank performance
            was satisfactory, the Borrower performance was satisfactory,
            sustainability was likely, and institutional development
            impact was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: it
            is recommended that the grant-based financing scheme be
            piloted in new schools to test its attractiveness and
            merits, its potential impact on school performance as well
            as to appreciate the degree of buy-in by teachers and School
            Management Committees (SMCs). Ministry of Education (MOE) is
            shifting to grants-based financing system, where resources
            going to institutions will be linked more closely to
            students on a per capita basis, rather than to teachers as
            it is currently the case. A draft grants-based financing
            system has been finalized but not yet adopted and a decision
            was taken to suspend Monthly Pay Order (MPO) for new non
            government schools. As a result, newly registered schools
            are likely to experience financial constraints which may
            have adverse effect on their performance. There is a need to
            improve the capacity of Bangladesh Bureau of Education
            Information and Statistics (BANBEIS) to provide regular
            updates on schools and better monitor education outcomes
            since the last school census was conducted in 1999 and an
            update was undertaken in 2005. BANBEIS is expecting to start
            by June 2008 the next census as it is already approved and
            the process of releasing the funds has begun. There may also
            be a need to develop a platform for integrating multiple
            databases that fall under MOE as was already evidenced by
            the uniformization of school codes between Education Boards
            and BANBEIS. This integration process, across various units
            of MOE, would, for instance, help to institutionalize
            student learning assessment as Secondary Education Quality
            and Access Enhancement Project (SEQAEP) project intends to
            do by benchmarking learning levels in Bangladesh to
            international standards such as Trends in International
            Mathematics and Science Study (TIMSS) or Program for
            International Student Assessment (PISA).
